result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott R. Meidam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The Defendant is to complete the Domestic Violence Intervention Program.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is to have no contact with HK.  The Defendant is not to use or possess any weapons or firearms.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
The Defendant is ordered to undergo an anger management assessment and follow any recommendations for counseling.
  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.
No contact whatsoever with HK on any property owned by her or where she resides or works.
No weapons can be owned or possessed by defendant.
Costs have been paid.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
